identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Government, Philanthropy and NGO

abstract.p: Photos of benefit dinners in New York City

block.p: Correction: February 4, 2007, Sunday An entry in the Evening Hours column last Sunday about the International Women's Health Coalition misidentified its chairwoman. She is Kati Marton -- not Catie Marron, who is the chairwoman of the New York Public Library. A picture caption also misidentified Ms. Marton. It was Ms. Marton -- not Adrienne Germain, president of the health coalition -- who was shown with Sarah Rosenthal and Shirley Lord Rosenthal.

Correction: April 8, 2007, Sunday An entry in the Evening Hours column on Jan. 28 about the Quadrille Society Bal d'Europe misspelled the surname of a guest. She is Anne Sitrick, not Sitricle. A letter on Jan. 29 pointing out the error did not reach the appropriate editors until Wednesday.

An entry in the Evening Hours column last Sunday about the International Women's Health Coalition misidentified its chairwoman. She is Kati Marton -- not Catie Marron, who is the chairwoman of the New York Public Library. A picture caption also misidentified Ms. Marton. It was Ms. Marton -- not Adrienne Germain, president of the health coalition -- who was shown with Sarah Rosenthal and Shirley Lord Rosenthal.

An entry in the Evening Hours column on Jan. 28 about the Quadrille Society Bal d'Europe misspelled the surname of a guest. She is Anne Sitrick, not Sitricle. A letter on Jan. 29 pointing out the error did not reach the appropriate editors until Wednesday.
